bruch module¶

class bruch.Bruch.Bruch(zaehler=0, nenner=1)¶

Bases: object

Bruch is a class, which has the capabilities to calculate a fraction with every possible mathematical usage scenario.

Parameters:
  • zaehler (int) – numerator of the fraction
  • nenner (int) – denominator of the fraction
_Bruch__makeBruch(other)¶

makeBruch not a predefined method and is static. It is used to make a Bruch object out of an int. :param other: a int value which shall be converted into a fraction object :return: returns the fraction object of for the parameter’s int value (other/1) :rtype: Bruch

__abs__()¶

Overrides the absolute value method and returns a fraction object containing both of the absolute values :return: a Bruch object containing zaehler first and nenner as the second value is returned :rtype: Bruch

__add__(other)¶

Overrides the add method to add a fraction or an int and return a float :param other: int or fraction, which shall be added :return: float value of the added variables :rtype: float :raise TypeError: incompatible types - other than int or fraction

__eq__(other)¶

Overrides the equals method and returns whether the self fraction is equal or not equal to another :param other: another fraction or int which self is compared to :return: returns whether the other fraction is equal or not equal to the current one :rtype: bool

__float__()¶

Overrides float to return the value of the fraction if the float method is called :return: the divided float value of the fraction is returned :rtype: float

__ge__(other)¶

Overrides greater than or equal to and returns whether other is greater than or equal to self :param other: another fraction or numeric data type which self is compared to :return: returns whether self is greater than or equal to other :rtype: bool

__gt__(other)¶

Overrides greater than and returns whether other is greater than self :param other: another fraction or numeric data type which self is compared to :return: returns whether self is greater than other :rtype: bool

__iadd__(other)¶

Overrides the in-place add method to add a in-place add a fraction or an int and return a fraction :param other: int or fraction, which shall be in-place added :return: fraction of the in-place added values :rtype: Bruch :raise TypeError: incompatible types - other than int or fraction

__imul__(other)¶

Overrides the in-place multiplication method to multiply a fraction or an int and return the calculated fraction :param other: int or fraction, which shall be multiplied with self :return: fraction of the completed multiplication :rtype: Bruch :raise TypeError: incompatible types - other than int or fraction

__init__(zaehler=0, nenner=1)¶

Constructor of the class Bruch, to identify the given object of the Bruch class and set it to the correct value otherwise default values (numerator=0, denominator=1 -> Value = 0) will be used. :param zaehler: represents the numerator throughout the application, is set to 0 as a default value :param nenner: represents the denominator throughout the application, is set to 1 as a default value :return: None :rtype: None

__int__()¶

Overrides the int method to return the parsed int value of the fraction :return: the parsed value of the current (self) fraction is being returned :rtype: int

__invert__()¶

Overrides invert to return the reciprocal fraction of the current self fraction :return: returns the reciprocal fraction of self :rtype: Bruch

__isub__(other)¶

Overrides the in-place subtraction method to subtract a fraction or an int and return a float :param other: int or fraction, which shall be subtracted :return: float value of the completed subtraction :rtype: float :raise TypeError: incompatible types - other than int or fraction

__iter__()¶

Overrides iterrator to make the class iterable, which is overwritten to give the possibility of coding the following: self.zaehler, self.nenner = Bruch :return: returns iterator object, which can iterate over all the objects in the container :rtype: object

__itruediv__(other)¶

Overrides the in-place division method to in-place divide a fraction or an int and return the calculated fraction :param other: int or fraction, which shall be divided by self :return: fraction of the completed division :rtype: Bruch :raise TypeError: incompatible types - other than int or fraction

__le__(other)¶

Overrides lower than or equal to and returns whether other is lower than or equal to self :param other: another fraction or numeric data type which self is compared to :return: returns whether self is lower than or equal to other :rtype: bool

__lt__(other)¶

Overrides lower than and returns whether other is lower than self :param other: another fraction or numeric data type which self is compared to :return: returns whether self is lower than other :rtype: bool

__mul__(other)¶

Overrides the multiplication method to multiply a fraction or an int and return the calculated fraction :param other: int or fraction, which shall be multiplied with self :return: fraction of the completed multiplication :rtype: Bruch :raise TypeError: incompatible types - other than int or fraction

__ne__(other)¶

Overrides not equals method and returns whether the self fraction is not equal to the other fraction :param other: another fraction or int type which self is compared to :return: returns whether the other fraction is not equal or equal :rtype: bool

__neg__()¶

Overrides negation to return the fraction self with the unused algebraic sign :return: returns the negated fraction of self :rtype: Bruch

__pow__(power)¶

Overrides power to return the fraction with the exponent (power) calculated correctly for the fraction self :param power: int with which the power will be calculated for the fraction :return: returns the fraction with the power calculated as an exponent :rtype: Bruch :raise TypeError: if the data type of power is not int

__radd__(other)¶

Overrides the right add method to right add a fraction or an int and return a float :param other: int or fraction, which shall be added :return: float value of the right added variables :rtype: float :raise TypeError: incompatible types - other than int or fraction

__repr__()¶

Overrides the representation method which returns a string of the current given fraction :return: the value of the fraction parsed to a string is returned :rtype: str

__rmul__(other)¶

Overrides the right multiplication method to right multiply a fraction or an int and return the calculated fraction :param other: int or fraction, which shall be multiplied with self :return: fraction of the completed multiplication :rtype: Bruch :raise TypeError: incompatible types - other than int or fraction

__rsub__(other)¶

Overrides the right subtraction method to right subtract a fraction or an int and return a float :param other: int or fraction, which shall be subtracted :return: float value of the completed right subtraction :rtype: float :raise TypeError: incompatible types - other than int or fraction

__sub__(other)¶

Overrides the subtraction method to subtract a fraction or an int and return a float :param other: int or fraction, which shall be subtracted :return: float value of the completed subtraction :rtype: float :raise TypeError: incompatible types - other than int or fraction

__truediv__(other)¶

Overrides the division method to divide a fraction or an int and return the calculated fraction truediv is used because of compatibility issues to python 3.x :param other: int or fraction, which shall be divided by self :return: fraction of the completed division :rtype: Bruch :raise TypeError: incompatible types - other than int or fraction
